thread.title: "Bronco Madness'' at Fayetteville State set for October 13
thread.title_full: "Bronco Madness'' at Fayetteville State set for October 13

author: A staff report
title: "Bronco Madness'' at Fayetteville State set for October 13
text:
"Bronco Madness'' at Fayetteville State set for October 13 A staff report 
Fayetteville State will conduct its annual "Bronco Madness'' on October 13 to tap off the 2015-16 men and women's basketball season. 
The event is open to the public and will be held from 7 to 8:30 p.m. at Capel Arena. 
Coaches and players from both teams will participate in brief scrimmages before greeting fans and participate in several contests. 
There will be student competitions such as an "Around the World" Three-Point Contest and a Bronco Madness Slam Dunk competition. Trophies will be rewarded to the best 3-point shooter and dunker. Giveaways and prizes will be distributed throughout the program. Deejay D-Roc will be on the "wheels of steel" providing the music. 
The Marching Bronco Express (MBX) and Cheer Phi Smoov will also perform during the event. 
The Fayetteville Flyers from the Carolina Wheelchair Basketball Conference and the National Wheelchair Basketball Association will also play a 10-minute running clock scrimmage between team introductions. 
The FSU women were picked to finish fourth and the men fifth in the Southern Division at the 2015 CIAA Preseason Media Day. The women start the regular season November 13 against Concord at Capel Arena as part of the two-day CIAA-MEC Challenge. The men open the same day against Tuskegee as part of the CIAA-SIAC Challenge in Alabama.
